Docs.summary: This is a primary interface in a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this primary interface only when the method you want to use shares the same name as an event of the COM object; in this case, cast to this interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Otherwise, use the .NET interface that is derived from the COM coclass to access methods, properties, and events of the COM object. For more information about the COM obect, see .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AttentionLine { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.AttentionLine : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the attention line text for a letter created by the Letter Wizard.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ CCList { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.CCList : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the carbon copy (CC) recipients for a letter created by the Letter Wizard.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Closing { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Closing : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the closing text for a letter created by the Letter Wizard (for example, "Sincerely yours").

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: For example, if the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DateFormat { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DateFormat : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the date for a letter created by the Letter Wizard.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Duplicate As LetterContent

Docs.summary: Returns a read-only object that represents the contents of the specified letter created by the Letter Wizard.

remarks.para: You can use the Duplicate property to pick up the settings of all the properties of a duplicated LetterContent object. You can assign the object returned by the Duplicate property to another object of the same type to apply those settings all at once. Before assigning the duplicate object to another object, you can change any of the properties of the duplicate object without affecting the original.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int EnclosureNumber { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.EnclosureNumber : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the number of enclosures for a letter created by the Letter Wizard.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IncludeHeaderFooter { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IncludeHeaderFooter : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the header and footer from the page design template are included in a letter created by the Letter Wizard.

remarks.para: Use the property to set the name of the template attached to a document created by the Letter Wizard.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool InfoBlock { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.InfoBlock : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Associated with the Letter Wizard in Microsoft Word. Not used in the U.S. English version of Word.

remarks.para: This property may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Letterhead { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Letterhead : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if space is reserved for a preprinted letterhead in a letter created by the Letter Wizard.

remarks.para: The property controls the size of the reserved letterhead space.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLetterheadLocation LetterheadLocation { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLetterheadLocation get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLetterheadLocation value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the location of the preprinted letterhead in a letter created by the Letter Wizard.

remarks.para: The LetterheadLocation property can be one of the constants.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space (in points) to be reserved for a preprinted letterhead in a letter created by the Letter Wizard.
